paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR(Met30) variant associated with familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy (FAP) in Portuguese patients, detailing penetrance data and individual cases.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Six of these subjects developed clinical FAP since 1975; TTR(Met30) was present in each of these subjects.
TTR(Met30) was found in 21 out of 41 asymptomatic FAP offspring.

functional_data.summary: The presence of TTR(Met30) in plasma constitutes a predictive biochemical marker of FAP in the preclinical phase of the disease.

variants.segregation_data: The mutant TTR segregated in accordance with the known autosomal dominant mode of inheritance of FAP.
variants.additional_notes: No difference was observed between carriers and noncarriers of the mutant TTR.
key_quotes: TTR(Met30) was found in 21 out of 41 asymptomatic FAP offspring.
Six of these subjects developed clinical FAP since 1975; TTR(Met30) was present in each of these subjects.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant was extracted from the main text.
